channel.title: Comments on: Rocking the Twenty Eleven Theme

item.title: By: Ashley Karyl
item.dc:creator: Ashley Karyl
item.description:
I rather like twenty eleven as a theme, which I am using on one of my sites. I did tweak it so that banners can be seen on all pages but there is something else I need to do and I wondered if anybody knows the answer....
When I installed the blog I had a site already on the domain, so I installed Wordpress in a directory /blog and that's great but I want to change it so that when you press the home button inside the blog it takes you to www.example.com and not www.example.com/blog. I've tried changing the settings inside Wordpress but I get an error, so I'm a bit lost and I wondered if this has to be done by changing the theme.
item.content:encoded:
I rather like twenty eleven as a theme, which I am using on one of my sites. I did tweak it so that banners can be seen on all pages but there is something else I need to do and I wondered if anybody knows the answer….

When I installed the blog I had a site already on the domain, so I installed WordPress in a directory /blog and that’s great but I want to change it so that when you press the home button inside the blog it takes you to http://www.example.com/ and not http://www.example.com/blog. I’ve tried changing the settings inside WordPress but I get an error, so I’m a bit lost and I wondered if this has to be done by changing the theme.

item.title: By: Rev. Voodoo
item.dc:creator: Rev. Voodoo
item.description: I'm liking twentyeleven so far myself. I see the popular thing is to hack that header down straight away. It's the same thing I did on VoodooPress within about 5 minutes. Wider theme, smaller header, move some stuff around. After a bit of tidying, twnetyelevn is OK in my books!
item.content:encoded: I’m liking twentyeleven so far myself. I see the popular thing is to hack that header down straight away. It’s the same thing I did on VoodooPress within about 5 minutes. Wider theme, smaller header, move some stuff around. After a bit of tidying, twnetyelevn is OK in my books!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/07/06/rocking-the-twenty-eleven-theme/#comment-3771">Michael</a>.
The twenty eleven header size a bit larger than I'd like. As far as content vs. header, I think on some sites I'd consider the header part of the content.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Michael.

The twenty eleven header size a bit larger than I’d like. As far as content vs. header, I think on some sites I’d consider the header part of the content.

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Eh, I'm about ready for the massive-header fad to be over anyway. What happened to content being the most important thing?
item.content:encoded: Eh, I’m about ready for the massive-header fad to be over anyway. What happened to content being the most important thing?

item.title: By: Patrick in Michigan
item.dc:creator: Patrick in Michigan
item.description:
Yes! This theme needs a option for centered content and two sidebars; left and right. If it had that; I'd use it in a heartbeat on my blog and rid myself of the theme I am using now.
If I knew how to to mod the thing, I'd do it myself and call it Twenty-Eleven Three. But I don't know how! :cry:
Anyhow, there's my suggestion for the theme itself.
-Pat
item.content:encoded:
Yes! This theme needs a option for centered content and two sidebars; left and right. If it had that; I’d use it in a heartbeat on my blog and rid myself of the theme I am using now.

If I knew how to to mod the thing, I’d do it myself and call it Twenty-Eleven Three. But I don’t know how! ðŸ˜¥

Anyhow, there’s my suggestion for the theme itself.

-Pat
